English:
Ah, Detective?
Please, I have a favor to ask you!
Chinese:
啊，偵探大人？
太好了，你會答應我的請求對不對！
Korean:
아, 탐정님?
해냈다, 내 부탁을 들어주는 거구나!
German:
Ach, Detektiv?
Ich muss dich um einen Gefallen bitten!

English:
So, when I went out to Shinjuku with my mother the
other day we saw this mysterious navy blue
creature!
Chinese:
你聽我說，我最近跟媽媽一起去新宿時，
在外面看到一隻藍藍的怪獸。
Korean:
있잖아, 요전에 엄마랑 신주쿠로 외출했을 때 말야
밖에서 새파란 괴수 씨를 봤어
German:
Neulich war ich mit meiner Mutter in Shinjuku, da
haben wir diese mysteriöse dunkelblaue
Kreatur gesehen!

English:
When I asked my friend he said "That's
MetalGreymon!"
Chinese:
我去問朋友，他告訴我
「那是機械暴龍獸！」。
Korean:
친구한테 물어봤더니
「그거 메탈그레이몬이야!」라고 알려줬어
German:
Als ich meinen Freund fragte, meinte er: „Das ist
MetalGreymon!“

English:
But anyway, his face looked really sad and he
looked cold, like was gonna freeze to death!
Chinese:
可是我覺得它好像很難過的樣子，
一定是因為天氣太冷，讓它凍僵了！
Korean:
하지만 왠지 말야, 엄청 슬픈 얼굴을 하고 있었어
분명 추워서 떨고 있는 거야!
German:
Aber wie dem auch sei, sein Gesicht wirkte so
traurig und er war ganz durchfroren!

English:
So, I want to give the creature a warm quilt as a
present.
Chinese:
所以我想送溫暖的棉被
給怪獸先生。
Korean:
그러니까 있지, 나 괴수 씨에게
따뜻한 이불을 선물하고 싶어
German:
Deshalb will ich der Kreatur eine warme Decke
schenken.

English: Will you come with me to that store over there?
Chinese:
啊，那邊有間商店。
可以跟我過來看一下嗎？
Korean:
지금 저기 가게가 열려 있어
따라와 줄래?
German: Kommst du mit mir zu dem Laden da drüben?

English:
Hey, please come inside and see our quilts. Today
there's a sale on! A special lower price, just for
today!
Chinese:
來唷來唷～棉被特價喔！
這個價格只有今天喔！
Korean:
자― 보고 가세요, 이불 세일입니다!
오늘만 특별판매예요―!
German:
He, hereinspaziert! Schaut euch unsere Decken an!
Heute hagelt es Sonderangebote! Alles zum
reduzierten Preis! Nur heute!

English:
Wow, look at that!
That blanket looks really fluffy and warm!
Chinese:
啊，你看！
那條毯子毛絨絨的感覺好溫暖喔。
Korean:
아, 봐봐!
저 담요, 굉장히 복슬복슬해서 따뜻해 보여
German:
Wow, schau dir das an!
Diese Decke sieht so flauschig und warm aus!

English:
Ah well, miss, you certainly have a good eye!
This blanket is made of high quality materials.
Just ask your babysitter if you can get it.
Chinese:
喔，這位小姐，妳眼光很好喔。
這條毯子的質料很高檔，
妳可以請旁邊的大人買給妳。
Korean:
오, 아가씨. 눈이 높구만
실은 이건 정말 좋은 소재로 만든 이불이야
거기 있는 보호자분에게 부탁해보면 어떨까
German:
Oh, junge Dame, du hast wirklich ein gutes Auge!
Diese Decke ist aus hochwertigem Material.
Frag deinen Babysitter, ob du sie haben kannst.

English:
Oh, please Detective, please buy that one!
I'm sure the creature will really like it!
Chinese:
偵探大人拜託你，買那條毯子好不好！
怪獸先生一定會很高興的。
Korean:
있지 부탁해, 탐정님. 저 이불을 사줘!
분명 괴수 씨도 기뻐해줄 거야
German:
Oh, bitte, Detektiv, kauf sie!
Ich bin mir sicher, dass sie der Kreatur
gefallen wird!

English:
This blanket was originally 12,000 yen, but it's
on sale for 10,000 yen today. Is this the one you
want?
Chinese:
這條毯子本來要價12000YEN，
現在打折下來只要10000YEN，怎麼能錯過呢？
Korean:
이 이불, 원래는 12000YEN이지만
지금은 세일해서 10000YEN이야. 물론 살 거지?
German:
Der normale Preis war 12 000 Yen, aber heute
kostet sie im Angebot nur 10 000 Yen.
Möchtest du die Decke?

English:
Couldn't we get the price lowered a bit?
Do you think this girl can pay that much?
Okay, let's get it.
Chinese:
可以再便宜一點嗎？
你叫這孩子付這筆巨款……？
那我買了。
Korean:
좀 더 싸게 안될까?
이 아이한테 그런 큰 돈을 내라고…?
그걸로 살게
German:
Könnten wir den Preis etwas senken?
Glaubst du, das Mädchen kann so viel zahlen?
Okay, wir nehmen sie.

English:
Huh? You want it cheaper than this?
Hmm... That's tough...
Chinese:
什麼？　再算便宜一點？
嗯……有點困難啊……
Korean:
뭐? 이거보다 좀 더 싸게 하고 싶은 거야?
으음―… 힘든걸…
German:
Was? Du möchtest sie billiger haben?
Hm ... Das ist nicht so einfach ...

English:
Well, I suppose...
If you're really going to buy it, I guess I could
lower the price a bit more...
Chinese:
不過如果客人要買那就沒辦法了，
我再給你一點優惠好了。
Korean:
하지만 어쩔 수 없지, 사준다고 한다면
조금만 더 서비스해줄까
German:
Nun ja ... Wenn du sie wirklich kaufst, könnte
ich den Preis wohl noch etwas senken ...

English:
Huh? No, you're paying for her, seeing as you're
the babysitter, right? Of course I wouldn't expect
this child to pay such a high price...
Chinese:
咦？　當然是身為監護人的你買單吧？
我怎麼可能叫這孩子付那麼多錢……
Korean:
뭐? 아니, 보호자인 네가 지불해주는 거잖아?
아무리 그래도 이 아이한테 터무니없는 큰 돈을 내라고 할 리가…
German:
Was? Nein, du bist doch der Babysitter und
bezahlst für sie, richtig? Natürlich erwarte ich
nicht, dass das Kind das bezahlen kann ...

English:
Oh! I see. Haha, in that case it's still too
expensive, I guess.
Chinese:
唔……！　唉呀～真是傷腦筋啊哈哈哈。
確實是還不夠便宜啦。
Korean:
……윽! 아니, 곤란한걸― 하하하
확실히 아직 좀 비쌌으려나
German:
Ach! Verstehe. In dem Fall ist es immer noch
zu teuer.

English:
Okay, it's a deal!
...Oh, doesn't look like you have enough, do you?
Chinese:
好！　買賣成交！
……是說你根本沒那麼多錢嘛。
Korean:
좋아! 거래 성립이다!
…그런데 너, 그만한 돈 갖고 있지 않잖아
German:
Okay, abgemacht!
... Ach, du hast wohl nicht genug?

English:
Okay, it's a deal then!
Take it before I change my mind.
Chinese: 好，買賣成交！　來，你拿去吧。
Korean: 좋아, 거래 성립이다! 자, 가져가라구
German:
Okay, dann ist es abgemacht!
Nimm sie, bevor ich meine Meinung ändere.

English:
I see... I'll knock off a bit more.
How about 8,000 yen for it?
Chinese:
這個嘛……不然我再降一點好了。
8000YEN！　這樣行了吧？
Korean:
그렇네… 조금만 더 깎아줄게
8000YEN! 이걸로 어때?
German:
Verstehe ... Dann reduziere ich den Preis noch
etwas. Wie wäre es mit 8000 Yen?

English:
It's still expensive! Bring it down a little more.
Just look into her eyes, can't you do any better?
Okay, let's get it.
Chinese:
還是太貴了！　再降一點。
你看著這孩子的眼睛還能說出一樣的話嗎？
那我買了。
Korean:
아직 비싸! 조금 더 깎아줘
이 아이의 눈을 보면서도 같은 말이 나와?
이걸로 살게
German:
Das ist immer noch teuer! Ich brauche mehr Rabatt.
Schau in ihre Augen. Hilft das nicht?
Okay, wir nehmen sie.

English:
Huh? You still trying to haggle me down?
You're gonna run me out of business!
Chinese:
什麼？　你還要殺價嗎？
再殺下去我就不用做生意了……
Korean:
뭐어? 너, 아직 깎을 셈이야?
이 이상은 장사가 안 된다고―…
German:
Was? Du willst immer noch mit mir feilschen?
So kann ich keine Geschäfte machen!

English: Huh?
Chinese: 咦？
Korean: 뭐?
German: Was?

English:
...Oh! Okay, okay! You've got me! If I lower the
price a little more, will you take it!?
Chinese:
啊～！　好啦，我知道了啦！
算我認輸！　我再降價一點總可以了吧！？
Korean:
……아―! 알겠어, 알겠다고!
내가 졌어! 좀 더 깎으면 되는 거지!?
German:
... Ach! Na gut! Du hast mich überzeugt! Wenn ich
den Preis noch etwas senke, nimmst du sie dann?

English:
It's a deal then! So you're buying it...but are
you sure you have enough?
Chinese:
好！　那我就賣給你了。
……是說你身上根本沒錢嘛。
Korean:
좋아! 그럼 너한테 팔게
…그런데 너, 돈 갖고 있지 않잖아
German:
Abgemacht! Du kaufst sie also ... Bist du sicher,
dass du auch genug hast?

English:
Okay, it's a deal then!
Take it before I change my mind.
Chinese: 好，買賣成交！　來，你拿去吧。
Korean: 좋아, 거래 성립니다! 자, 가져가라고
German:
Okay, dann ist es abgemacht!
Nimm sie, bevor ich meine Meinung ändere.

English:
Well, what can you do" So that's it?
6,000 yen! I can't let it go for any less.
So, you'll take it then?
Chinese:
真拿你沒辦法，這是最後一次囉？
6000YEN！　不能再更便宜了。
客人你決定要買了嗎？
Korean:
어쩔 수 없지, 이게 마지막이야?
6000YEN! 이 이상은 양보 못 해
자, 살 거야?
German:
Nun ja, was soll’s. Sagen wir ...
6000 Yen! Weniger geht nicht.
Du nimmst sie also?

English:
Knock off another 1,000 yen!
....Okay, let's go home then.
Right, let's take it.
Chinese:
再便宜1000YEN就好！
……我們回去吧。
那我買了。
Korean:
1000YEN만 더 깎아줘!
……자, 돌아갈까
이걸로 살게
German:
Geh noch um 1000 Yen runter!
... Okay, gehen wir nach Hause.
Okay, wir nehmen sie.

English:
I was going to say "Knock off another 1,000 yen,"
but I don't have enough money for it, so I'm going
to have to give up...
Chinese:
本來想叫老闆再少算1000YEN的，
但身上的錢不夠。
只能放棄了嗎……
Korean:
1000YEN만 더 깎아줘!
…라고 흥정할까 생각했지만 소지금이 부족하다
포기할 수밖에 없나…
German:
Ich wollte, dass du noch um 1000 Yen runtergehst,
aber ich habe nicht genug Geld dafür, also
muss ich aufgeben ...

English:
Unfortunately, I don't have enough money with me,
I'm going to have to pass...
Chinese:
真可惜，身上的錢不夠。
只能放棄了嗎……
Korean:
…안타깝게도 소지금이 부족하다
포기할 수밖에 없나…
German:
Leider habe ich nicht genug Geld bei mir.
Tut mir leid, das wird nichts.

English: I can't! If I go any lower I won't make a profit!
Chinese: 不行啦！　再降下去我會沒有利潤的！
Korean: 안돼! 이 이상은 이익이 없어져버려!
German:
Unmöglich! Wenn ich noch weiter runtergehe,
verdiene ich nichts!

English: Oh but please sir! Pretty please!
Chinese: 叔叔！　求求你！
Korean: 아저씨! 부탁이에요!
German: Ach, bitte, Sir! Bitte bitte!

English:
"Sir"...!? You make it sound like I'm some old man
or something!
Chinese: 叔……！　我還沒有那麼老好不好……！
Korean: 아저…! 난 아직 그런 나이가 아니야…!
German:
„Sir“ ...?! Das klingt ja, als ob ich ein alter
Mann wäre!

English:
Right now there's a little child out there who's
cold and worried and... Just, please!
Chinese:
有一個人在外面快被凍僵了，
它很需要這條毯子……求求你！
Korean:
지금도 밖에서 추워서 떨고 있는 아이가 있어요
이걸 필요로 하고 있는 아이가 있어요… 부탁이에요!
German:
Da draußen ist ein kleines Kind. Ihm ist kalt
und es hat Angst ... Ach, bitte!

English:
Wha'...? Okay, when you put it like that, I
suppose I can't say no... Fine, I'll knock another
1,000 yen off, but that's it!
Chinese:
唔……妳這麼說，叫我怎麼忍心不降價呢……
我明白了，真的只能再便宜1000YEN喔！
Korean:
윽… 그렇게까지 말하면 거절할 수 없게 되잖아…
알았어, 앞으로 1000YEN만이야!
German:
Was? Na gut, wenn ich das so höre, dann kann ich
wohl nicht Nein sagen. Na schön, ich gehe noch
1000 Yen runter, aber das war’s!

English:
Okay, that's 5,000 yen.
Give the blanket to your friend.
Chinese:
那我就收下這5000YEN了。
來，快點拿去給妳的朋友吧。
Korean:
그럼 5000YEN 확실히 받았어
자, 그 친구에게 가져다주라고
German:
5000 Yen dann bitte.
Gib deinem Freund die Decke.

English:
Huh? N-no!
If I don't buy this that child will freeze!
Chinese:
咦？　那、那怎麼行！
不買這條毯子，那個人會凍壞的……！
Korean:
어? 아, 안돼요!
이걸 사지 않으면 그 아이가 얼어버려요…!
German:
Was? N-Nein!
Wenn ich sie nicht kaufe, erfriert das Kind!

English:
Listen, I don't know anything about any children,
but if you're not buying you're not a customer,
you're just a nuisance. Please leave immediately!
Chinese:
誰管你什麼那個人這個人的，
既然不買就不是客人了。
你們會妨礙我做生意的，快點到別的地方去！
Korean:
저 아이든 그 아이든 나는 몰라
자, 사지 않을 거면 손님이 아니지
장사 방해니까 빨리 어딘가로 가줘!
German:
Hör zu, ich weiß nichts von irgendwelchen Kindern,
aber wer nichts kauft, ist kein Kunde, sondern
stört nur. Geh jetzt bitte!

English: Wait!
Chinese: 給我等一下！
Korean: 잠깐 기다려!
German: Moment!

English: Ah, Mom!
Chinese: 呃，老媽！
Korean: 켁, 엄마!
German: Ach, Mama!

English:
You were going to sell this to that young girl for
such a high price!? I never realized that I raised
such an awful child!
Chinese:
你想叫這麼小的孩子買那麼貴的東西？
我可不記得有教出像你這樣的兒子！
Korean:
이런 어린 아이에게 그런 고액으로 팔아치울 생각이냐?
나는 그런 아들로 키운 기억이 없어!
German:
Du wolltest sie einem jungen Mädchen zu so einem
hohen Preis verkaufen?! Ich hatte keine Ahnung,
wen ich da großgezogen habe!

English:
No, I'm trying to do business with her
babysitter...
Chinese:
哪有，我是要跟這位監護人
做生意啊……
Korean:
아니, 내가 흥정하려고 하고 있는 건
이쪽의 보호자인데…
German:
Nein, ich versuche, mit ihrem Babysitter zu
verhandeln ...

English:
It doesn't matter which of them it is!
They obviously have their reasons!
Chinese:
跟誰不都一樣！
而且他們好像有什麼苦衷……
Korean:
어느 쪽이든 똑같앗!
게다가 뭔가 사정이 있는 것 같잖아…
German:
Wer es ist, spielt keine Rolle!
Sie haben offensichtlich ihre Gründe!

English:
It's fine, please take the blanket, and don't
worry about the cost. Make sure this poor person
in need gets it!
Chinese:
沒關係，這條毯子你們拿去吧。
多少錢你們就不用在意了。
快點拿去給需要的人。
Korean:
괜찮아, 이 이불을 갖고 가렴
대금은 신경 쓰지 않아도 돼
빨리 이걸 필요로 하고 있는 사람에게 가져다주렴
German:
Es ist schon gut. Bitte nimm die Decke und keine
Sorge wegen der Kosten. Sorg dafür, dass diese
arme Person sie bekommt!

English: Thank you, ma'am!
Chinese: 謝謝妳，阿姨！
Korean: 고마워요, 아주머니!
German: Vielen Dank, gnädige Frau!

English:
Okay, it's a deal then! Take it before I change my
mind.
Chinese: 好，買賣成交！　來，你拿去吧。
Korean: 좋아, 거래 성립이다! 자, 가져가라고
German:
Okay, dann ist es abgemacht!
Nimm sie, bevor ich meine Meinung ändere.

English:
Thank you!
I'm sure this will make the creature happy!
Chinese:
謝謝你！
這下那個怪獸先生一定會很高興的。
Korean:
고마워요!
분명 이걸로 그 괴수 씨도 기뻐해줄 거야
German:
Danke!
Die Kreatur wird sich sicher freuen!

English: My mom says I'm not allowed to go too far away...
Chinese:
媽媽有叮嚀我
不可以跑去太遠的地方……
Korean:
난 엄마가 신신당부해서
그렇게 멀리까지 못 가니까…
German:
Meine Mama sagt, dass ich nicht zu weit weggehen
darf ...

English:
So, I'd like you to take this to the creature
instead.
Chinese:
所以想請你幫我
把這條毯子送去給怪獸先生。
Korean:
그러니까 내 대신
이 이불을 괴수 씨에게 전해줬으면 해
German:
Deshalb möchte ich, dass du sie der Kreatur
bringst.

English: Please, Detective!
Chinese: 拜託你了，偵探大人！
Korean: 부탁해, 탐정님!
German: Bitte, Detektiv!

English:
That creature that I saw in Shinjuku, his name is
MetalGreymon, and he's probably still freezing out
there... Please go take this blanket to him!
Chinese:
新宿的那個怪獸先生好像叫機械暴龍獸。
它說不定還因為天氣冷而在發抖……
快點把那條毯子拿給它吧。
Korean:
신주쿠에 있던 괴수 씨는 메탈그레이몬이래
아직 추워서 떨고 있을지도 몰라
그 이불, 빨리 전해줘
German:
Die Kreatur in Shinjuku ... Sie heißt
MetalGreymon. Ihr ist sicher noch ganz kalt.
Bitte bring ihr diese Decke!

English: Rrk... Damn... Huh?
Chinese:
呼、呼……可惡……
嗯？
Korean:
하아, 하아… 제길…
응?
German: Rrk ... Mist ... Was?

English:
What is it? If you don't want anything, just go
away! I'll bite you!!!
Chinese:
幹嘛，沒事就快滾。
再不走，小心我吃掉你喔。
Korean:
뭐야, 아무것도 아니면 빨리 가버려
가지 않으면 먹어버릴 거야
German:
Was ist denn? Wenn du nichts willst, geh wieder
weg! Sonst beiße ich dich!

English:
Huh? This...a little human girl got this for me?
I looked cold, so she asked you to bring me this?
Chinese:
什麼？　這東西……是一個人類的女孩要送我的？
她說看我好像很冷，所以叫你拿給我嗎？
Korean:
뭐? 이걸… 인간 여자아이가 나한테?
추워보이니까 전해주라고 한 거야?
German:
Was? ... Ein kleines Menschenmädchen hat sie
für mich besorgt? Ich sah aus, als ob ich fror?
Deshalb bringst du mir die?

English: Wow...
Chinese: 嘿咻……
Korean: 엇차……
German: Wow ...

English: ...Oh, it's so warm!
Chinese: 呼……好溫暖啊。
Korean: ……아아, 따뜻하네
German: Ach, sie ist so warm!

English: But, to be honest, I wasn't actually cold.
Chinese: 不過，其實我一點都不冷。
Korean: 하지만 말야, 난 별로 추웠던 게 아니야
German: Aber um ehrlich zu sein, war mir gar nicht kalt.

English:
After I came to this world, I was afraid some
heartless humans would attack me, so I quickly
changed my body.
Chinese:
來到這個世界後，我一想到會被無情的人類攻擊就很害怕，
所以急急忙忙改造身體。
Korean:
이 세상에 온 후 무정한 인간한테 습격받을지도 모른다고 생각하면 무서워서
몸을 개조하는 걸 서두르고 있었어
German:
Nachdem ich in diese Welt kam, hatte ich Angst
vor angriffslustigen herzlosen Menschen, also habe
ich meinen Körper schnell angepasst.

English:
But because I rushed the changes my body hasn't
caught up yet...so I'm walking around in pain like
this. I suppose I must have looked cold.
Chinese:
但胡亂改造的結果，讓身體反而跟不上步調……好痛！
她可能是看到我走路的姿勢，以為我很冷吧。
Korean:
하지만 개조를 무리하게 해버린 탓에 몸이 따라가질 못해서… 아야얏
이런 상태로 걸어다녔으니 추워보인 거려나
German:
Aber weil es schnell gehen musste, hat mein Körper
noch nicht aufgeholt ... Deshalb laufe ich so rum.
Vielleicht wirkt es, als ob mir kalt ist.

English:
This blanket is super warm!
Humans...are actually very nice.
Chinese:
毯子好溫暖喔。
人類……其實很溫柔呢。
Korean:
이불 굉장히 따뜻해
인간은… 사실은 다정하구나
German:
Diese Decke ist so warm!
Menschen ... sind doch sehr nett.

English:
So, could you give this to that little girl,
please?
Chinese: 對了，你可以把這東西交給那個女孩嗎？
Korean: 있지, 그 여자아이에게 이걸 전해주지 않을래?
German: Könntest du das bitte dem kleinen Mädchen geben?

English: And please tell her I said thanks for the blanket!
Chinese:
然後幫我轉告她「謝謝妳的毯子」，
拜託你囉。
Korean:
그거랑「이불 고마워」라고 전해줘
부탁할게
German: Und bitte bedanke dich bei ihr für die Decke!

English:
...It's really warm.
Please tell the little girl thanks for me.
Chinese: 好溫暖啊……記得幫我轉告那個女孩。
Korean: ……엄청 따뜻해. 그 여자아이에게 전해줘
German:
Sie ist wirklich warm.
Bitte bedanke dich für mich bei dem Mädchen.

English:
Detective! Ah, you don't have the blanket!
So you found that creature then, right?
Chinese:
偵探大人！
啊，你手上沒有毯子！　你見到那個怪獸先生了吧？
Korean:
탐정님!
아, 이불 안 갖고 있네! 그 괴수 씨랑 만난 거지?
German:
Detektiv! Oh, du hast die Decke nicht mehr!
Du hast die Kreatur also gefunden?

English:
Was he happy with it?
...Really!? That's great!
Chinese:
怪獸先生有很高興嗎？
……真的嗎！？　太好了。
Korean:
괴수 씨, 기뻐했어?
…정말!? 다행이다아
German:
Hat sie sich darüber gefreut?
... Wirklich?! Das ist toll!

English: Huh? The creature gave me a present?
Chinese: 什麼？　怪獸先生有東西要送給我？
Korean: 어? 괴수 씨가 나한테 주는 선물이 있다구?
German:
Was? Die Kreatur hat dir ein Geschenk für mich
gegeben?

English: Ah...
German: Ah ...

English:
The odd-shaped music box plays a sweet tune from
the palm of the little girl's hand.
Chinese:
變形的音樂盒
在女孩手中演奏著優美的音樂……
Korean:
찌그러진 모양의 오르골이
여자아이의 손 위에서 다정한 음악을 연주하고 있다…
German:
Auf der Handfläche des kleinen Mädchens erklingt
eine süße Melodie aus der ungewöhnlich
geformten Spieluhr.

English:
I don't know what to say, but...for some reason I
feel all warm and tingly!
Chinese:
我……不知道該說什麼才好。
但總覺得……心裡暖呼呼的。
Korean:
그게, 뭐라고 말해야 할지 모르겠어
하지만 왠지… 마음이 따뜻해졌어
German:
Ich weiß nicht, was ich sagen soll, aber ...
Irgendwie wird mir ganz warm ums Herz!

English:
Even though it's little cold today...that's weird.
Detective, thank you for taking my case.
Chinese:
今天明明就有點冷……真奇怪。
偵探大人，謝謝你答應我的請求。
Korean:
오늘 좀 추운데도… 이상하네
탐정님, 부탁을 들어줘서 고마워
German:
Auch wenn es heute etwas kalt ist ... seltsam.
Danke, dass du meinen Fall übernommen hast,
Detektiv.

English: You see...I'm moving to Hokkaido tomorrow.
Chinese: 其實……我明天就要搬去北海道了。
Korean: ……있잖아, 나 내일 홋카이도로 이사가
German: Morgen ziehe ich nämlich nach Hokkaido.

English:
I was feeling sad about having to leave all my
friends, but hearing this has made me feel better!
Chinese:
雖然跟朋友分開很寂寞，
但我會聽這個音樂盒，打起精神的！
Korean:
친구랑 헤어져서 외롭다고 생각하고 있었지만
이걸 듣고 힘을 낼게!
German:
Ich war traurig, weil ich all meine Freunde
zurücklassen muss, aber jetzt geht’s mir besser!

English:
I feel all warm...
That's pretty weird, isn't it?
Chinese:
好溫暖……
感覺好奇妙哦。
Korean:
따뜻해…
왠지 신기하네
German:
Mir ist ganz warm zumute ...
Das ist seltsam, oder?
